name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Beijing Golden Shield Publishing House issued a statement

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Today, a netizen named "Arctic Catfish" attracted public attention by posting comments such as "There are 9 figures in my family" and "Of course I like the old Chinese, all the money in my family is used by leeks". The netizen also posted a photo of his family and his former leader. The incident quickly topped the hot search list, and it was later revealed that his grandfather was only the director of a district-level transportation bureau in Shenzhen.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Subsequently, Shenzhen Transportation issued an announcement. Her grandfather, Zhong, responded that his granddaughter was crying because of the controversial remarks, and he wrote a document to the leader, hoping that it would be investigated thoroughly, fearing that it would affect the reputation of the unit and his granddaughter's studies.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Currently, the account "Arctic Catfish" has been banned by Weibo.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Li Xuezheng's Baidu entry was deleted

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
The Harbin Institute of Technology’s official account shows that Wang Bailing, vice dean of the School of Computer Science and Technology, led 11 undergraduates to carry out the “overseas network positive energy transmission mission” during major national events, and received a letter of thanks from the Cyberspace Administration of China.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @ycxulie Many accounts have been closed recently due to two-factor authentication.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The latest news is that the account that reported the incident with real name was renamed "Qingdao Golden Shield Film and Television Culture Media Company", the Weibo authentication was also modified, and the profile picture was deleted.
However, due to my own experience of being banned many times, users cannot modify their usernames and profile pictures during the ban period.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Sohu News released a video on Bilibili titled "The building is built, but I don't have the chance to walk in anymore", speaking out for the elderly migrant workers.
The video said that recently, the issue of protecting the employment rights and interests of over-age migrant workers has entered the vision of the whole society. Faced with the "clearance order", all walks of life called for not "one size fits all". There are nearly 300 million migrant workers in my country. Paying attention to their present is paying attention to our future.
